intro: Cissus adenantha, commonly known as the climbing cissus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Vitaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its trailing or climbing habit, with slender, woody stems that can grow up to several meters in length. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped or ovate, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. Cissus adenantha produces small, greenish-white flowers that are borne in clusters, followed by small, round berries that are edible.
